posts.name: 694 Director of Design/Electronics/Awards | 23513 Mechanical/Electrical Lead
posts.cooked: Hello, I am a student from FRC team 694 StuyPulse. As surprising as it may seem, I accidentally deleted our entire team from Onshape, causing all of our documents to scatter among past members. We have lost our team organization that has been existing for years, so we really need to recover this as soon as possible. I would really appreciate if anyone can help me on this.

link_counts.title: FRC 694 StuyPulse | 2025 Build Thread | Open Alliance

posts.cooked: have you reached out to onshape support about this yet?

posts.name: 694 Director of Design/Electronics/Awards | 23513 Mechanical/Electrical Lead
posts.cooked: Yes, but we are in a hurry since we have so many offseason projects going on and considering that the more time passes, the more likely the team will get deleted permanently.

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
@Drew_B

Is there anything you can do to help our worlds 2025 Daly aisle neighbors?

posts.name: Joseph Walters
694 Director of Design/Electronics/Awards | 23513 Mechanical/Electrical Lead
posts.cooked: I had an Onshape education classroom under an identical name, and since I had just gotten admin access, I didn’t realize that I was actually deleting our team instead of the classroom. Thank you for the advice, we will definitely reflect and take extra precautions from now on.
Thanks for sharing, mistakes do happen unfortunately. Hopefully we can find a way to get the documents back

posts.name: Samjackjoetedpaulbill
posts.cooked:
Preface this with - I have been here before, I accidentally issued a command in AIX (consider it the IBM version of Linux) that attempted to delete literally the entire operating system from the disk and being Linux there’s no confirmation. Standard practice in IT, always name test or dev environments with a portion of the name that signifies it is non-production but if you’re not paying attention (like me that day) accidents can happen

Ever since that day when I’ve said to myself “what’s the worst that could happen?” I think quite carefully.

posts.name: Drew B.
posts.cooked: For those following along at home, it sounds like this is resolved and everything is back in place!

posts.name: 694 Director of Design/Electronics/Awards | 23513 Mechanical/Electrical Lead
posts.cooked: Indeed, we got the team recovered just yesterday thanks to the Onshape Support professionals! Thank you all for your concerns, we are so glad to be back go CADding!
